destinations.name: Art in the Valley
destinations.description: Guest artist, Kat Sloma  has created a series of 30 works of art from one photographic image.The results are spectacular! Come to Art in the Valley and enjoy the reception while viewing this special exhibit. And check out work by our member artists, as well.

destinations.name: ArtWorks (CEI) Gallery
destinations.description: Opening reception for Dana Reason, Ethnographer.  An assemblage of Magnetic tape, paper, ink and plastic.

destinations.name: Azure Fine Art Gallery
destinations.summary: Come celebrate the Chinese New Year & the Red Monkey King with amazing discounts on past work and mischievous new Chinese & Monkey inspired work.

destinations.name: Kaleidoscope Studios
destinations.description: Forget pink and red, February is the month for purple!  Mardi Gras, amethyst, even lovely early-blooming crocus.  At Kaleidoscope, we’ll have art on our walls by a variety of local artists, all with purple.  While here, you can vote for your favorite entries in our Passionate about Purple bead challenge, and register to win art from Old World Center artists and receive a free amethyst stone or bead!

destinations.name: Cyrano's
destinations.description: Pushing the beginning of Spring, come in and see bright new journals, fun colors and patterns.  Bright and Light Jewelry for Spring and Summer by Elaine.  Take part in a make and take and learn how to make a paper German bell.

destinations.name: Brittney West
destinations.summary: Come check out West's new oil painting on a silver platter and other recent mixed-media artwork. All are welcome!
destinations.description: West invites you into her art studio where you can browse over a decade of oil paintings, mixed media drawings and experimental pieces such as her recent oil painting on an antique silver platter. Engage in your right brain, get to know more about her process and inspiration, and browse through her Eco-Prints for sale.

destinations.name: Studio262
destinations.description: Opening reception for "Gifts from the Sea", new intricate glass & ceramic sea inspired works by Rinee Merritt & Annclaire Greig. Also preview a poster compilation of the Studio262 Love Notes installation - continue to share the community thoughts and make 2016 a year of inspiration!

destinations.name: Foundy Annex
destinations.description: Opening for ouro new creative work space & micro gallery, with work by Christopher Adams / Corvidopolis.

destinations.name: Studio Beatrice
destinations.description:
Guest artist, Jenny Armitage  Will show watercolors from places you may have been (or maybe not!)

She will also bring some whimsical polymer sculptures that will amaze you. Marshall Adams will entertain us with musical surprises.

Kathi will offer a taste of Spindrift wine.

destinations.name: Fairbanks Art Gallery
destinations.summary: The San Quentin Prison Report Archive Project
destinations.description: Doug Nigel Poor, The San Quentin Prison Report Archive Project: A collaboration between artist Nigel Poor and the Men from San Quentin State Prison. Inkjet prints with handwritten text. Feb 8-March 1. Visiting Artists & Scholars Reception, Feb 10 at LaSells Steward Center at 6pm, lecture at 7pm.

destinations.name: Jeff Hess Studio
destinations.description:
Shannon Weber's work is unique and thought provoking.  I could use words like burnt wood and sea weed in an attempt to describe it but none of that does it justice.  For me, some of her pieces evoke what feel like primitive memories and other pieces look like musical chords. 

She's also a fun person to meet and talk to and I'm excited to host her visit.

destinations.name: Pegasus & Old World Deli
destinations.description: Pegasus Gallery hosts The Cascades Workshops Exhibit with painters Mark Allison and Bill Shumway, celebrating 20 years or workshops in Sisters Oregon near Metolius and Clrar Lake.

destinations.name: PopTart
destinations.description: Poptart & Ugly Art Room present an anti Valentine's Day group art show along with $25 tattoos, a photo booth, snacks & libations by Corvallis Brewing Supply. Check out uglyartroom.com for artist information.

destinations.name: Rachel Urista / Laurel Thompson
destinations.description: This month the artists are showing work from their hearts with a new studio Mural and Abstract paintings on display. Rachel will be showcasing “Painting With Wild Abandon,” an ongoing series of intuitive paintings, expressive & abstract, with an edgy quality. Come see her unique style up close. Laurel will be working on a new mural on the studio walls. Mural live-painting, 6-8pm. Watch Laurel bring the studio walls to life!

destinations.name: The Arts Center
destinations.description:
Kaitlyn Wittig Mengüç will present her performance art piece “Wake”. She will interpret the ritual of a wake, but now for a tree. All steps of a regular wake are involved: arrival, portraits, a toast, food. Depending on the audience Wittig Mengüç may perform the piece multiple times.

Ecologist Dr. Mark Harmon makes wood block research samples available to create an ever-changing interactive mosaic. The mosaic will be time-lapsed photographed and the result posted on TAC’s social media.  Some blocks will be available as mementos.

destinations.name: Corvallis Swing
destinations.summary: Swing dancing at Old World Deli
destinations.description:
We will be dancing on stage at the Old World Deli as part of the monthly Corvallis Arts Walk!! 

Our time will be short but sweet. Let's dance and celebrate together!!

destinations.name: Living Room Gallery
destinations.description: New CAW destination, the "Living Room Gallery" is a micro gallery curated by Angela Waetje.
